title.narrative: 2.3: INCREASED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

description.narrative: More parents, teachers, adolescents and other stakeholders have increased knowledge and skills to eliminate harmful practices and better protect children from violence, exploitation and grave violations, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022 more children, especially the most vulnerable, are better protected from violence, exploitation and grave violations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: More parents, teachers, adolescents and other stakeholders have increased knowledge and skills to eliminate harmful practicesand better protect children from violence, exploitation and grave violations

description.narrative: The National Intersectoral Violence Against Children Strategy (NIVAC 2021-2023) was launched in February 2021 with line ministries, CSOs and development partners, after being updated to reflect COVID-19 needs.To reduce violence at home, in schools and communities, UNICEF supported life skills for 1,300 adolescents focusing on violence prevention and promotion of non-violence; while 2,360 teachers, principals and counsellors and 4,200 caregivers were reached through awareness sessions on positive discipline and non-violence. Grave violations affecting 6,534 children were verified and data informed programming and advocacy, particularly during increased tension in East Jerusalem and conflict escalation in Gaza in 2021. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2022

baseline.value: No child friendly procedures for justice actors

actual.value: 2019:SOPs were developed for children in conflict with the law in Gaza, but lacked ownership by all stakeholders and was not applied in WB.
